attributes.description: Processing speed for real-time collision evaluation.
attributes.name: processingSpeed

attributes.description: Precision of detection in identifying potential collision courses.
attributes.name: detectionPrecision

attributes.description: Ensures the system operates under harsh flight conditions.
attributes.name: environmentalAdaptability

attributes.description: Self-monitoring and recovery capabilities for continuous function.
attributes.name: faultTolerance
attributes.value: Automatic component failover and re-initialization mechanisms

designScenario.description: The Collision Avoidance System ensures aircraft safety by providing timely alerts and evasion guidance to prevent aerial collisions. By processing inputs from onboard sensors, radar, and secure communications with neighboring aircraft, it predicts potential collisions and advises maneuvering strategies.
designScenario.name: Collision Avoidance System

details.description: Must process data inputs from radar, GPS, and onboard sensors in real-time.
Provide collision warning alerts at least 10 seconds prior to a potential impact.
Operate continuously with an evaluation cycle of 10 milliseconds.
Maintain processing latency below 50 milliseconds under full operation.
Ensure operation redundancy to handle system component failure without degradation of service.
Provide clear alert signals distinguishable from other cockpit notifications.
Comply with international aviation standards for electronic flight systems.
Operate reliably across diverse environmental and weather conditions.

relationships.description: Radar system transmits real-time spatial data to the collision detection module for evaluation.
The collision detection module directs instructions to the alert system to notify pilots.
Communications device exchanges position and trajectory data with nearby aircraft systems.

systemComponents.description: Primary analytics unit processes spatial and kinematic data for identifying collision threats.
systemComponents.name: Collision Detection Module

subComponents.description: Core computational subsystem for evaluating potential collisions based on collected data.
subComponents.name: Processing Core

subComponents.description: Data fusion engine integrating inputs from radar, sensors, and communication devices.
subComponents.name: Data Integration Unit

systemComponents.description: Detection instrument providing range and relative bearing to nearby aircraft.
systemComponents.name: Radar

systemComponents.description: Communication interface for airplane-to-airplane and control tower data sharing.
systemComponents.name: Communication Device

systemComponents.description: Notification component delivering visual and auditory warnings to pilots.
systemComponents.name: Alert System

comments.body: This block represents the overall Collision Avoidance System including its key subsystems.
Sensor Array includes redundant sensor components for fail-safe operations.
Data Processing Unit provides high-speed data processing capabilities for real-time collision assessment.
Control Unit is responsible for immediate response and intervention based on processed data.

rag_context: The Collision Avoidance System is designed to continuously monitor the surrounding airspace for potential threats and obstacles, providing real-time data to the control unit for immediate response and intervention. It must feature high-speed data processing capabilities to detect and react to collision risks within a specified timeframe. The system should incorporate redundant sensors and advanced algorithms to ensure fail-safe operations and accurate threat assessment. Additionally, the Collision Avoidance System must comply with aviation regulations and standards, offering a reliable and effective solution for preventing mid-air collisions and ensuring flight safety.
